name: Addons Manager - Steel - Fx 4+ Resurrected!!!
description:
For Firefox 4+ and latest Firefox Beta, Aurora, and Nightly builds.

This style was resurrected, since user 169 deleted style 36762. I restored style to the "Check for updates" button in AOM 'Available Updates' category and restored "[Ext]Add-on Manager Hilite"(AMH) compatibility and updated "[Ext]Is it Compatible?" style compatibility and also added "[Ext]Scriptify" and "[Ext]Extension List Dumper" style compatibility, and also gave "[Ext]TabGroups Menu" an styled add-on icon in AOM add-on list view, and hide AOM "Get Add-ons" category and the AOM scroll-bar which can be restored under the style code section:

/* =========== hide stuff =========== */

Tested on Firefox 4 and up to the latest Firefox Beta, Aurora, Nightly builds.

To customize or fix Firefox Beta, Aurora, and Nightly builds, you can also have a look at my other styles: user 61655
additional_info: Updated 04-06-2012 Styled Add-on Download Progress bars... Updated 03-30-2012 Set text color for Add-ons In-Content UI(in tab) Options(preferences titles). Updated 03-21-2012 Due to Bug 693510 - drop support for prefixes from border-radius* and box-shadow ***!important*** Info for Stylish users... For those that use the extension Stylish, to be able to view your installed userstyles within a dialog window instead of viewing them in the Add-on Manager set about:config preference: extensions.stylish.manageView; set to 1 And if want to use the original Stylish Editor(Not the new Orion Editor it now uses) set about:config preference: extensions.stylish.editor; set to 1 (A browser Restart may be required for those Stylish preferences to go into effect) Recommended Add-ons: 1. Is It Compatible?: https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/addon/is-it-compatible/versions/ 2. Addon Manager Fix Lite: By Add-on developer Srazzano, it adds sort buttons Name & Last Updated & Status to the Add-ons Manager: http://www.fileden.com/files/2012/4/11/3290879/Addon%20Manager%20Fix%20Lite-1.6.xpi 3. Addons Manager Hilite: https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/addon/addons-manager-hilite/versions/ 4. Extension List Dumper: https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/addon/extension-list-dumper/versions/ 5. Scriptify: https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/addon/scriptify/versions/ It can convert Userscripts into Restart-less '.xpi' extensions, once the Userscripts are converted into extensions you can choose to disable or uninstall the extension Scriptify. No longer needing to have add-ons (Greasemonkey or Scriptish) installed. Note: Regarding Stylish Userstyles, the new add-on Scriptify does not work on "Stylish only userstyles", but does work for some userstyles, that have been properly tested and state can be installed with Add-on (Greasemonkey) on userstyles.org .
